abstract: Wall Street is already trying to estimate how much President Obama’s financial regulatory proposal, known as the Volcker Rule, will cut into its profits.
snippet: Wall Street is already trying to estimate how much President Obama’s financial regulatory proposal, known as the Volcker Rule, will cut into its profits.
lead_paragraph: President Obama is pushing hard for stricter financial regulation, promising in his first State of the Union address that he would not sign a bill that “does not meet the test of real reform.” This has left Wall Street wondering how much Mr. Obama’s regulatory proposal, known as the Volcker Rule, will cut into its profits.

headline.main: Wall St. Tries to Put a Price on Volcker Rule
